parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To will, intend, desire, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to 'will, ' i.e. be willing.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To use, make use of, deal with, take advantage of.
Levity, fickleness, lightness. From elaphros; levity, i.e. Fickleness.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To deliberate, take counsel, determine. From boule; to advise, i.e. deliberate, or resolve.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
Yes, certainly, even so. A primary particle of strong affirmation; yes.
Yes, certainly, even so. A primary particle of strong affirmation; yes.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
